intro: Stellaster transbaicalensis, commonly known as the Baikal starflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Lake Baikal region in Russia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats along the shores of Lake Baikal. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with a star-like appearance, giving it its common name. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
